content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Stone Furnace at position (0.0, 0.0)
Consists of a stone furnace that smelts iron ore into iron plates using coal. Throughout these steps, the furnace has been used repeatedly for smelting operations with multiple cycles of insertions (iron ore and coal) and extractions (iron plates). The furnace’s activity history—spanning extraction of remaining iron plates, repeated smelting attempts with varied input quantities, and adjustments of production cycles—demonstrates its central role in processing raw resources into refined iron plates.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Repeated smelting production delays
  - When the furnace repeatedly yields fewer iron plates than expected, verify the input ratios and consider extending wait times or checking furnace energy and fuel states to ensure optimal performance.

• Incorrect argument types for insertion operations (previous)
  - Ensure that inserts to the furnace use valid entity references rather than position values.

• Insufficient inventory for input operations (previous)
  - Confirm that inventories contain the required resource quantities before attempting insertions to avoid errors related to resource shortages.

• Crafting prerequisite errors (previous)
  - Validate the availability of all necessary raw materials before initiating crafting operations.
